name: rosa blanda
description:
All native Rosa species attract a multitude of pollinators, have large attractive flowers, red stems and large rose hips in fall.  They are also semi-aggressive and les suitable for small landscapes.*This species (in seed) may be difficult and/or slow to germinate and
grow to maturity.  Please note the germination code.  Dormant bare root plants ship each year during optimal transplanting season: Spring (April/May). Age: 1 yr; approx. 18” of top growth
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
